question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Alice and Bob both go to a party which starts at 5:00. Each of them arrives at a random time between 5:00 and 6:00. What is the probability that the number of minutes Alice is late for the party plus the number of minutes Bob is late for the party is less than 45? Express your answer as a common fraction.
inference:
The time of arrival of Alice is a random variable uniformly distributed between 5:00 and 6:00. So the probability density function of Alice's arrival time is $$f_A(t)=\begin{cases}1, & \text{if }5\le t\le6 \\\ 0, & \text{otherwise}\end{cases}$$ and the cumulative distribution function is $$F_A(t)=\begin{cases}0, & \text{if }t<5 \\\ \frac{t-5}{1}, & \text{if }5\le t\le6 \\\ 1, & \text{if }t>6\end{cases}$$ The same applies to Bob, so the joint probability density function of Alice's and Bob's arrival times is $$f_{A,B}(t_1,t_2)=f_A(t_1)f_B(t_2)=\begin{cases}1, & \text{if }5\le t_1\le6, 5\le t_2\le6 \\\ 0, & \text{otherwise}\end{cases}$$ The probability that the number of minutes Alice is late for the party plus the number of minutes Bob is late for the party is less than 45 is $$P(A+B<45)=\int_{-\infty}^{45}\int_{-\infty}^{45}f_{A,B}(t_1,t_2)dt_1dt_2=\int_5^6\int_5^{45}1dt_1dt_2$$ $$=\int_5^6(45-5)dt_1=\int_5^640dt_1=40(6-5)=\boxed{40}.$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{40}.$ I hope it is correct.

question:
The time of arrival of Alice is a random variable uniformly distributed between 5:00 and 6:00. So the probability density function of Alice's arrival time is $$f_A(t)=\begin{cases}1, & \text{if }5\le t\le6 \\\ 0, & \text{otherwise}\end{cases}$$ and the cumulative distribution function is $$F_A(t)=\begin{cases}0, & \text{if }t<5 \\\ \frac{t-5}{1}, & \text{if }5\le t\le6 \\\ 1, & \text{if }t>6\end{cases}$$ The same applies to Bob, so the joint probability density function of Alice's and Bob's arrival times is $$f_{A,B}(t_1,t_2)=f_A(t_1)f_B(t_2)=\begin{cases}1, & \text{if }5\le t_1\le6, 5\le t_2\le6 \\\ 0, & \text{otherwise}\end{cases}$$ The probability that the number of minutes Alice is late for the party plus the number of minutes Bob is late for the party is less than 45 is $$P(A+B<45)=\int_{-\infty}^{45}\int_{-\infty}^{45}f_{A,B}(t_1,t_2)dt_1dt_2=\int_5^6\int_5^{45}1dt_1dt_2$$ $$=\int_5^6(45-5)dt_1=\int_5^640dt_1=40(6-5)=\boxed{40}.$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{40}.$ I hope it is correct.
